service.title: HTTP State Management Mechanism
service.documentation: This document defines the HTTP Cookie and Set-Cookie header fields. These header fields can be used by HTTP servers to store state (called cookies) at HTTP user agents, letting the servers maintain a stateful session over the mostly stateless HTTP protocol. Although cookies have many historical infelicities that degrade their security and privacy, the Cookie and Set-Cookie header fields are widely used on the Internet.

http-header.documentation: The Set-Cookie HTTP response header is used to send cookies from the server to the user agent.
The user agent sends stored cookies to the origin server in the Cookie header.
